alert.note: Alert for Bradley; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 9:10PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bradley, Polk, southeastern McMinn and southwestern Monroe Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1010 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Charleston to Cohutta. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Benton, Etowah, Wildwood Lake, East Cleveland, South Cleveland, Waterville, Coker Creek, Conasauga and Big Frog Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bradley; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
